credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Elevation of an apse with altar
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
description: The entablature of the altar is in the same height than that of the chapel; part of the supports being the same for either. A frame of a reversed image is supported by angels before the entablature under the circular pediment. Statues of female figures stand laterally beside the mensa.
name: Drawing
